definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: Chinese salaries may only equal blue collar pay abroad.
sentences.chinese: 中国的工资可能只等同于国外蓝领的收入水平。

sentences.english: Haslem can do the dirty work.
sentences.chinese: 哈斯勒姆可以做蓝领工作。

sentences.english: We have close working relationships with some of the world's leading blue-chip companies.
sentences.chinese: 我们与世界上一些著名的蓝领公司有着很密切的关系。

sentences.english: Suzie, do you prefer the shirt with the white collar Or the one with the blue collar?
sentences.chinese: 苏西，你更喜欢那件白领的衬衣还是那件蓝领的呢？

sentences.english: Chris has a lot more blue-collar in him than I do, despite his management-level career.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯虽然身为管理人员，却比我更像蓝领。

sentences.english: After several sleepless nights, he decided to take a factory job.
sentences.chinese: 经过几个不眠之夜的思考，他决定去当一位蓝领工人。

sentences.english: He was a blue-collar worker and worked very hard but that was the extent of getting dirty.
sentences.chinese: 父亲是一个蓝领工人，他工作很努力而且有点脏。

sentences.english: They capitalize on a particularly difficult set of circumstances for blue-collar workers.
sentences.chinese: 他们利用了一系列不利于蓝领工人的环境。

sentences.english: The pattern is inspired by the camouflage colors commonly worn by blue-collared workers in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 图案设计灵感源自于北京好多蓝领工人常穿的迷彩色。

sentences.english: On the right, for the most part, are the below-the-line folks—the blue-collar guys.
sentences.chinese: 大部分右翼分子都是生活在底层的蓝领。

sentences.english: Another type of collar that may be effective is a halter collar.
sentences.chinese: 另一种是蓝领，可有效预防是一个笼头衣领。

sentences.english: Blue-collar kids, as often as not, took the jobs their mothers and fathers retired from.
sentences.chinese: 蓝领工人的孩子通常都是在父母退休之后接他们的班。

sentences.english: My boss is wearing his blue tie, so it must be a Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 我老板打着他的蓝领带，哦，今天一定是星期四吧。
蓝领男孩和害羞的女孩。

sentences.english: It is said that many blue-collared workers suffer from psychological problems.
sentences.chinese: 据说，很多蓝领都有心理疾病。

sentences.english: More than 2000 students have been the work of the major companies in the high-level blue-collar class.
sentences.chinese: 已有二千多名学生工作在各大企业的高级蓝领阶层。

definition: to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
